subject: Sleep
title: REM Sleep and Procedural Memory
description: A short lesson to help you apply REM Sleep and Procedural Memory.

hook.text: A pianist practices a difficult passage before bed. The next morning, her fingers play it flawlessly.

buildup.text: Procedural memory covers skills: playing music, typing, riding a bike, and athletic movements.

discovery.text: REM sleep consolidates procedural memories by replaying motor patterns in the brain's movement centers.

twist.text: Performance improves after sleep even without additional practice. Sleep itself is the final rehearsal.

climax.text: Depriving someone of REM sleep after learning a motor skill blocks this overnight improvement entirely.

punchline.text: Practice makes progress. Sleep makes perfect.

quiz.question: Which sleep stage consolidates procedural motor skills?
